cinnamon.engine.object

Class ContactGraph<E extends ContactGraph.Contact>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.object.ContactGraph<E>

  • public abstract class ContactGraph<E extends ContactGraph.Contact>
extends Object

    ContactGraph models the relationship a ContactGraph.Contact represents between colliding BodyComponents.

    This representation is formed as an undirected graph where each node represents a BodyComponent and each link is a Contact. The graph itself is meant to encompass the whole game area with all bodies added. Having bodies as nodes and Contacts as links leads to a graph whose links are constantly added and removed in accordance with the physics being applied to the bodies.


    When two bodies collide, determined from outside the ContactGraph, the collision should be reported with addContact(BodyComponent, BodyComponent) and the returned Contact be used for storing implementation specific contact data. Specific Contacts can be removed with removeContact(BodyComponent, BodyComponent) or a pass on all Contacts can be done with removeInvalidContacts(), delegating the definition of an invalid Contact to overrides of isInvalid(Contact).


    Sleeping components

    ContactGraph also offers a sleep optimization (also known as deactivation) for groups of bodies through the graph's connected components. All non-static bodies are arranged according to connected components and checked for optimization eligibility. Below is an example of handling this optimization. 


         

     // Update each component's sleeping
     for (int component = 0, count = graph.getComponentCount(); component < count; component++) {

         // Sleep if allowed to
         if (graph.isSleepEligible(component)) {
             graph.sleep(component);

         } else {
             // Wake since shouldn't be sleeping
             graph.wake(component);
         }
     }

        public ContactGraph(int capacity)

        Constructs a ContactGraph with an initial capacity for BodyComponents.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public final boolean add(BodyComponent body)

        Adds a BodyComponent to the ContactGraph.

        Parameters:
        body - body.
        Returns:
        false if the body was not added because it already belongs to a ContactGraph (even if it's the same graph as the one calling this method).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the body capacity has already been reached and no more bodies can be added without removing.

      • addContact

        public final E addContact(BodyComponent bodyA,
                          BodyComponent bodyB)

        Creates a ContactGraph.Contact between two BodyComponents.

        The BodyComponent passed in as bodyA becomes the key in Contact lookup.

        Parameters:
        bodyA - body A.
        bodyB - body B.
        Returns:
        Contact.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either body is null or does not exist in the graph.

        Parameters:
        body - body.
        Returns:
        true if in graph.

      • getContact

        public final E getContact(BodyComponent bodyA,
                          BodyComponent bodyB)

        Gets the ContactGraph.Contact between two BodyComponents.

        If there is no Contact associated with the two bodies with the first argument matching the BodyComponent returned by a Contact's ContactGraph.Contact.getBodyA(), this method returns null.

        Parameters:
        bodyA - body A.
        bodyB - body B.
        Returns:
        Contact.

        public final boolean hasContact(BodyComponent body)

        Checks if a BodyComponent has ContactGraph.Contact with any other body.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if colliding with at least one other body.

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()

        Checks if the ContactGraph has no BodyComponents.

        Returns:
        true if there are no bodies.

      • isSleepEligible

        public final boolean isSleepEligible(int component)

        Checks if a component is eligible for sleep.

        Parameters:
        component - component.
        Returns:
        true if component can be put to sleep.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the component is < 0 or >= getComponentCount().

      • remove

        public final boolean remove(BodyComponent body)

        Removes a BodyComponent from the graph.

        All ContactGraph.Contacts between the body and its neighbors are removed as well.

        Parameters:
        body - body.
        Returns:
        false if body does not belong to the graph.

      • removeContact

        public final boolean removeContact(BodyComponent bodyA,
                                   BodyComponent bodyB)

        Removes the ContactGraph.Contact between two BodyComponents.

        The correct A-B body order must be specified in the arguments in order to match a Contact. I.e. if the Contact to remove's body A is given as argument bodyB, this method will return false.

        Parameters:
        bodyA - body A.
        bodyB - body B.
        Returns:
        false if no Contact was found.

      • removeInvalidContacts

        public final void removeInvalidContacts()

        Removes all ContactGraph.Contacts in the graph where isInvalid(Contact) is true.

      • size

        public final int size()

        Gets the number of BodyComponents.

        Returns:
        body count.

      • sleep

        public final void sleep(int component)

        Sleeps all BodyComponents in the specified component.

        Parameters:
        component - component.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the component is < 0 or >= getComponentCount().

      • wake

        public final void wake(int component)

        Wakes all BodyComponents in the specified component.

        Parameters:
        component - component.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the component is < 0 or >= getComponentCount().
